holidays.name: New Year's Day
holidays.description: January 1 is a day off for most people in Norway.

holidays.name: Princess Ingrid Alexandra's day
holidays.description: Princess Ingrid Alexandra of Norway's birthday is a flag day, when the Norwegian flag is flown on all flag poles.

holidays.name: The Saami people's day
holidays.description: The Saami People's Day is publicly celebrated in Norway by flying the Norwegian and Saami flags.

holidays.name: Carnival
holidays.description: For Carnival, Norwegians traditionally serve wheat buns filled with whipped cream.

holidays.name: Mother's Day
holidays.description: Mother's Day is on the second Sunday in February in Norway.

holidays.name: Valentine's Day
holidays.description: Valentine’s Day is a special time to celebrate love, romance and friendship.

holidays.name: King Harald V's day
holidays.description: King Harald V of Norway's birthday is a flag day.

holidays.name: Palm Sunday
holidays.description: Palm Sunday is the Sunday before Easter Sunday and commemorates Jesus' arrival in Jerusalem.

holidays.name: Maundy Thursday
holidays.description: Maundy Thursday commemorates Jesus Christ’s last supper with his disciples.

holidays.name: Good Friday
holidays.description: Good Friday commemorates Jesus Christ’s Passion, crucifixion, and death.

holidays.name: Holy Saturday
holidays.description: Holy Saturday is also known as Easter Saturday, and is the day before Easter Sunday.

holidays.name: Easter Sunday
holidays.description: Easter Sunday is a day off for most in Norway.

holidays.name: Easter Monday
holidays.description: Easter Monday in Norway is the last day of the Easter holiday.

holidays.name: Labor day
holidays.description: Labor Day or May Day on May 1 is a public holiday day in Norway.

holidays.name: Day of liberation
holidays.description: Liberation Day in Norway marks the end of the German occupation during the second World War.

holidays.name: Pentecost Eve
holidays.description: Pentecost Eve is not a public holiday in Norway, but shops close earlier than normal.

holidays.name: Whit Sunday
holidays.description: Whit Sunday or Pentecost is a public holiday in Norway.

holidays.name: Whit Monday
holidays.description: Whit Monday is a public holiday in Norway, making the Pentecost weekend a long weekend.

holidays.name: Midsummer Eve
holidays.description: Traditionally, people celebrate Midsummer's Eve by gathering around a large bonfire.

holidays.name: Queen Sonja's day
holidays.description: H.M. Queen Sonja of Norway's birthday is a flag day, when the Norwegian flag is flown on all flag poles.

holidays.name: Crown Prince Haakon's day
holidays.description: July 20 is H.K.H. Crown Prince Haakon birthday and a flag day in Norway.

holidays.name: Crown Princess Mette-Marit's day
holidays.description: August 19 is Crown Princess Mette Marit 's birthday is a flag day in Norway.

holidays.name: United Nations Day
holidays.description: The UN Day is on October 24 and is mainly marked in schools and kindergartens in Norway.

holidays.name: Halloween
holidays.description: Halloween is a festive occasion that is celebrated in many countries on October 31 each year.

holidays.name: Father's Day
holidays.description: Father’s Day celebrates fatherhood and male parenting on different dates worldwide.

holidays.name: Christmas Eve
holidays.description: Norwegians exchange gifts and get together for the main Christmas celebrations on December 24.

holidays.name: Christmas Day
holidays.description: Christmas Day is one of the biggest Christian celebrations and falls on December 25 in the Gregorian calendar.

holidays.name: Boxing Day
holidays.description: Boxing Day on December 26 is a public holiday in Norway

holidays.name: New Year's Eve
holidays.description: New Year’s Eve is the last day of the year, December 31, in the Gregorian calendar.
